deepof.post_hoc moduleÔÉÅ

Data structures and functions for analyzing supervised and unsupervised model results.

deepof.post_hoc.recluster(coordinates: deepof_coordinates, embeddings: deepof_table_dict, soft_counts: Optional[deepof_table_dict] = None, min_confidence: float = 0.75, states: Union[str, int] = 'aic', pretrained: Union[bool, str] = False, min_states: int = 2, max_states: int = 25, save: bool = True)ÔÉÅ

Recluster the data using a HMM-based approach. If soft_counts is provided, the model will use the soft cluster assignments as priors for a semi-supervised HMM.

Parameters:

  • coordinates ‚Äì deepOF project where the data is stored.

  • embeddings (table_dict) ‚Äì table dict with neural embeddings per animal experiment across time.

  • soft_counts (table_dict) ‚Äì table dict with soft cluster assignments per animal experiment across time.

  • min_confidence (float) ‚Äì minimum confidence the model should assign to a data point for the model to avoid resorting to a uniform prior around it.

  • states ‚Äì Number of states to use for the HMM. If ‚Äúaic‚Äù or ‚Äúbic‚Äù, the number of states is chosen by minimizing the AIC or BIC criteria (respectively) over a predefined range of states.

  • pretrained ‚Äì Whether to use a pretrained model or not. If True, DeepOF will search for an existing file with the provided parameters. If a string, DeepOF will search for a file with the provided name.

  • min_states ‚Äì Minimum number of states to use for the HMM if automatic search is enabled.

  • max_states ‚Äì Maximum number of states to use for the HMM if automatic search is enabled.

  • save ‚Äì Whether to save the trained model or not.

Returns:

table dict with soft cluster assignments per animal experiment across time, using the new HMM-based segmentation on the embedding space.

Return type:

soft_counts (table_dict)

deepof.post_hoc.get_time_on_cluster(soft_counts: deepof_table_dict, breaks: deepof_table_dict, normalize: bool = True, reduce_dim: bool = False)ÔÉÅ

Compute how much each animal spends on each cluster.

Requires a set of cluster assignments and their corresponding breaks.

Parameters:

  • soft_counts (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of soft counts, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the soft counts for each condition.

  • breaks (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of breaks, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the breaks for each condition.

  • normalize (bool) ‚Äì Whether to normalize the time by the total number of frames in each condition.

  • reduce_dim (bool) ‚Äì Whether to reduce the dimensionality of the embeddings to 2D. If False, the embeddings are kept in their original dimensionality.

Returns:

A dataframe with the time spent on each cluster for each experiment.

deepof.post_hoc.get_aggregated_embedding(embedding: ndarray, reduce_dim: bool = False, agg: str = 'mean')ÔÉÅ

Aggregate the embeddings of a set of videos, using the specified aggregation method.

Instead of an embedding per chunk, the function returns an embedding per experiment.

Parameters:

  • embedding (np.ndarray) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the embeddings for each condition.

  • reduce_dim (bool) ‚Äì Whether to reduce the dimensionality of the embeddings to 2D. If False, the embeddings are kept in their original dimensionality.

  • agg (str) ‚Äì The aggregation method to use. Can be either ‚Äúmean‚Äù or ‚Äúmedian‚Äù.

Returns:

A dataframe with the aggregated embeddings for each experiment.

deepof.post_hoc.select_time_bin(embedding: Optional[deepof_table_dict] = None, soft_counts: Optional[deepof_table_dict] = None, breaks: Optional[deepof_table_dict] = None, supervised_annotations: Optional[deepof_table_dict] = None, bin_size: int = 0, bin_index: int = 0, precomputed: Optional[ndarray] = None)ÔÉÅ

Select a time bin and filters all relevant objects (embeddings, soft_counts, breaks, and supervised annotations).

Parameters:

  • embedding (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the embeddings for each condition.

  • soft_counts (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of soft counts, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the soft counts for each condition.

  • breaks (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of breaks, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the breaks for each condition.

  • supervised_annotations (TableDict) ‚Äì table dict with supervised annotations per animal experiment across time.

  • bin_size (int) ‚Äì The size of the time bin to select.

  • bin_index (int) ‚Äì The index of the time bin to select.

  • precomputed (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Boolean array. If provided, ignores every othe parameter and just indexes each experiment using the provided mask.

Returns:

A tuple of the filtered embeddings, soft counts, and breaks.

deepof.post_hoc.condition_distance_binning(embedding: deepof_table_dict, soft_counts: deepof_table_dict, breaks: deepof_table_dict, exp_conditions: dict, start_bin: Optional[int] = None, end_bin: Optional[int] = None, step_bin: Optional[int] = None, scan_mode: str = 'growing_window', precomputed_bins: Optional[ndarray] = None, agg: str = 'mean', metric: str = 'auc', n_jobs: int = 10)ÔÉÅ

Compute the distance between the embeddings of two conditions, using the specified aggregation method.

Parameters:

  • embedding (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the embeddings for each condition.

  • soft_counts (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of soft counts, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the soft counts for each condition.

  • breaks (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of breaks, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the breaks for each condition.

  • exp_conditions (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary of experimental conditions, where the keys are the names of the experiments, and the values are the names of their corresponding experimental conditions.

  • start_bin (int) ‚Äì The index of the first bin to compute the distance for.

  • end_bin (int) ‚Äì The index of the last bin to compute the distance for.

  • step_bin (int) ‚Äì The step size of the bins to compute the distance for.

  • scan_mode (str) ‚Äì The mode to use for computing the distance. Can be one of ‚Äúgrowing-window‚Äù (used to select optimal binning), ‚Äúper-bin‚Äù (used to evaluate how discriminability evolves in subsequent bins of a specified size) or ‚Äúprecomputed‚Äù, which requires a numpy ndarray with bin IDs to be passed to precomputed_bins.

  • precomputed_bins (np.ndarray) ‚Äì numpy array with IDs mapping to different bins, not necessarily having the same size. Difference across conditions for each of these bins will be reported.

  • agg (str) ‚Äì The aggregation method to use. Can be either ‚Äúmean‚Äù, ‚Äúmedian‚Äù, or ‚Äútime_on_cluster‚Äù.

  • metric (str) ‚Äì The distance metric to use. Can be either ‚Äúauc‚Äù (where the reported ‚Äòdistance‚Äô is based on performance of a classifier when separating aggregated embeddings), or ‚Äúwasserstein‚Äù (which computes distances based on optimal transport).

  • n_jobs (int) ‚Äì The number of jobs to use for parallel processing.

Returns:

An array with distances between conditions across the resulting time bins

deepof.post_hoc.separation_between_conditions(cur_embedding: deepof_table_dict, cur_soft_counts: deepof_table_dict, cur_breaks: deepof_table_dict, exp_conditions: dict, agg: str, metric: str)ÔÉÅ

Compute the distance between the embeddings of two conditions, using the specified aggregation method.

Parameters:

  • cur_embedding (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the embeddings for each condition.

  • cur_soft_counts (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of soft counts, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the soft counts for each condition.

  • cur_breaks (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of breaks, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the breaks for each condition.

  • exp_conditions (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary of experimental conditions, where the keys are the names of the experiments, and the values are the names of their corresponding experimental conditions.

  • agg (str) ‚Äì The aggregation method to use. Can be one of ‚Äútime on cluster‚Äù, ‚Äúmean‚Äù, or ‚Äúmedian‚Äù.

  • metric (str) ‚Äì The distance metric to use. Can be either ‚Äúauc‚Äù (where the reported ‚Äòdistance‚Äô is based on performance of a classifier when separating aggregated embeddings), or ‚Äúwasserstein‚Äù (which computes distances based on optimal transport).

Returns:

The distance between the embeddings of the two conditions.

deepof.post_hoc.fit_normative_global_model(global_normal_embeddings: DataFrame)ÔÉÅ

Fit a global model to the normal embeddings.

Parameters:

global_normal_embeddings (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the embeddings for each condition.

Returns:

A fitted global model.

deepof.post_hoc.enrichment_across_conditions(embedding: Optional[deepof_table_dict] = None, soft_counts: Optional[deepof_table_dict] = None, breaks: Optional[deepof_table_dict] = None, supervised_annotations: Optional[deepof_table_dict] = None, exp_conditions: Optional[dict] = None, bin_size: Optional[int] = None, bin_index: Optional[int] = None, precomputed: Optional[ndarray] = None, normalize: bool = False)ÔÉÅ

Compute the population of each cluster across conditions.

Parameters:

  • embedding (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the embeddings for each condition.

  • soft_counts (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of soft counts, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the soft counts for each condition.

  • breaks (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of breaks, where the keys are the names of the experimental

  • supervised_annotations (tableDict) ‚Äì table dict with supervised annotations per animal experiment across time.

  • exp_conditions (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary of experimental conditions, where the keys are the names of the experiments, and the values are the names of their corresponding experimental conditions.

  • bin_size (int) ‚Äì The size of the time bins to use. If None, the embeddings are not binned.

  • bin_index (int) ‚Äì The index of the bin to use. If None, the embeddings are not binned.

  • precomputed (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Boolean array. If provided, ignores every othe parameter and just indexes each experiment using the provided mask.

  • normalize (bool) ‚Äì Whether to normalize the population of each cluster across conditions.

Returns:

A long format dataframe with the population of each cluster across conditions.

deepof.post_hoc.get_transitions(state_sequence: list, n_states: int)ÔÉÅ

Compute the transitions between states in a state sequence.

Parameters:

  • state_sequence (list) ‚Äì A list of states.

  • n_states (int) ‚Äì The number of states.

Returns:

The resulting transition matrix.

deepof.post_hoc.compute_transition_matrix_per_condition(embedding: deepof_table_dict, soft_counts: deepof_table_dict, breaks: deepof_table_dict, exp_conditions: dict, silence_diagonal: bool = False, bin_size: Optional[int] = None, bin_index: Optional[int] = None, aggregate: str = True, normalize: str = True)ÔÉÅ

Compute the transition matrices specific to each condition.

Parameters:

  • embedding (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the embeddings for each condition.

  • soft_counts (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of soft counts, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the soft counts for each condition.

  • breaks (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of breaks, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the breaks for each condition.

  • exp_conditions (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary of experimental conditions, where the keys are the names of the experiments, and the values are the names of their corresponding

  • silence_diagonal (bool) ‚Äì If True, diagonal elements on the transition matrix are set to zero.

  • bin_size (int) ‚Äì The size of the time bins to use. If None, the embeddings are not binned.

  • bin_index (int) ‚Äì The index of the bin to use. If None, the embeddings are not binned.

  • aggregate (str) ‚Äì Whether to aggregate the embeddings across time.

  • normalize (str) ‚Äì Whether to normalize the population of each cluster across conditions.

Returns:

A dictionary of transition matrices, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the transition matrices for each condition.

deepof.post_hoc.compute_steady_state(transition_matrices: dict, return_entropy: bool = False, n_iters: int = 100000)ÔÉÅ

Compute the steady state of each transition matrix provided in a dictionary.

Parameters:

  • transition_matrices (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary of transition matrices, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the transition matrices for each condition.

  • return_entropy (bool) ‚Äì Whether to return the entropy of the steady state. If False, the steady states themselves are returned.

  • n_iters (int) ‚Äì The number of iterations to use for the Markov chain.

Returns:

A dictionary of steady states, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the steady states for each condition. If return_entropy is True, values correspond to the entropy of each steady state.

deepof.post_hoc.compute_UMAP(embeddings, cluster_assignments)ÔÉÅ

Compute UMAP embeddings for visualization purposes.

deepof.post_hoc.align_deepof_kinematics_with_unsupervised_labels(deepof_project: deepof_coordinates, kin_derivative: int = 1, include_feature_derivatives: bool = False, include_distances: bool = True, include_angles: bool = True, include_areas: bool = True, animal_id: Optional[str] = None)ÔÉÅ

Align kinematics with unsupervised labels.

In order to annotate time chunks with as many relevant features as possible, this function aligns the kinematics of a deepof project (speed and acceleration of body parts, distances, and angles) with the hard cluster assignments obtained from the unsupervised pipeline.

Parameters:

  • deepof_project (coordinates) ‚Äì A deepof.Project object.

  • kin_derivative (int) ‚Äì The order of the derivative to use for the kinematics. 1 = speed, 2 = acceleration, etc.

  • include_feature_derivatives (bool) ‚Äì Whether to compute speed on distances, angles, and areas, if they are included.

  • include_distances (bool) ‚Äì Whether to include distances in the alignment.

  • include_angles (bool) ‚Äì Whether to include angles in the alignment.

  • include_areas (bool) ‚Äì Whether to include areas in the alignment.

  • animal_id (str) ‚Äì The animal ID to use, in case of multi-animal projects.

Returns:

A dictionary of aligned kinematics, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the aligned kinematics for each condition.

deepof.post_hoc.chunk_summary_statistics(chunked_dataset: ndarray, body_part_names: list)ÔÉÅ

Extract summary statistics from a chunked dataset using seglearn.

Parameters:

  • chunked_dataset (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Preprocessed training set (of shape chunks x time x features), where each entry corresponds to a time chunk of data.

  • body_part_names (list) ‚Äì A list of the names of the body parts.

Returns:

A dataframe of kinematic features, of shape chunks by features.

deepof.post_hoc.annotate_time_chunks(deepof_project: deepof_coordinates, soft_counts: deepof_table_dict, breaks: deepof_table_dict, supervised_annotations: Optional[deepof_table_dict] = None, window_size: Optional[int] = None, window_step: int = 1, animal_id: Optional[str] = None, samples: int = 10000, min_confidence: float = 0.0, kin_derivative: int = 1, include_distances: bool = True, include_angles: bool = True, include_areas: bool = True, aggregate: str = 'mean')ÔÉÅ

Annotate time chunks produced after change-point detection using the unsupervised pipeline.

Uses a set of summary statistics coming from kinematics, distances, angles, and supervised labels when provided.

Parameters:

  • deepof_project (coordinates) ‚Äì Project object.

  • soft_counts (table_dict) ‚Äì matrix with soft cluster assignments produced by the unsupervised pipeline.

  • breaks (table_dict) ‚Äì the breaks for each condition.

  • supervised_annotations (table_dict) ‚Äì set of supervised annotations produced by the supervised pipeline withing deepof.

  • window_size (int) ‚Äì Minimum size of the applied ruptures. If automatic_changepoints is False, specifies the size of the sliding window to pass through the data to generate training instances. None defaults to video frame-rate.

  • window_step (int) ‚Äì Specifies the minimum jump for the rupture algorithms. If automatic_changepoints is False, specifies the step to take when sliding the aforementioned window. In this case, a value of 1 indicates a true sliding window, and a value equal to window_size splits the data into non-overlapping chunks.

  • animal_id (str) ‚Äì The animal ID to use, in case of multi-animal projects.

  • samples (int) ‚Äì Time chunks samples to take to reduce computational time. Defaults to the minimum between 10000 and the number of available chunks.

  • min_confidence (float) ‚Äì minimum confidence in cluster assignments used for quality control filtering.

  • kin_derivative (int) ‚Äì The order of the derivative to use for the kinematics. 1 = speed, 2 = acceleration, etc.

  • include_distances (bool) ‚Äì Whether to include distances in the alignment. kin_derivative is taken into account.

  • include_angles (bool) ‚Äì Whether to include angles in the alignment. kin_derivative is taken into account.

  • include_areas (bool) ‚Äì Whether to include areas in the alignment. kin_derivative is taken into account.

  • aggregate (str) ‚Äì aggregation mode. Can be either ‚Äúmean‚Äù (computationally cheapest), just use the average per feature, or ‚Äúseglearn‚Äù which runs a thorough feature extraction and selection pipeline on each time series.

Returns:

A dataframe of kinematic features, of shape chunks by features.

deepof.post_hoc.chunk_cv_splitter(chunk_stats: DataFrame, breaks: dict, n_folds: Optional[int] = None)ÔÉÅ

Split a dataset into training and testing sets, grouped by video.

Given a matrix with extracted features per chunk, returns a list containing a set of cross-validation folds, grouped by experimental video. This makes sure that chunks coming from the same experiment will never be leaked between training and testing sets.

Parameters:

  • chunk_stats (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì matrix with statistics per chunk, sorted by experiment.

  • breaks (dict) ‚Äì dictionary containing ruprures per video.

  • n_folds (int) ‚Äì number of cross-validation folds to compute.

Returns:

list containing a training and testing set per CV fold.

deepof.post_hoc.train_supervised_cluster_detectors(chunk_stats: DataFrame, hard_counts: ndarray, sampled_breaks: dict, n_folds: Optional[int] = None, verbose: int = 1)ÔÉÅ

Train supervised models to detect clusters from kinematic features.

Parameters:

  • chunk_stats (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì table with descriptive statistics for a series of sequences (‚Äòchunks‚Äô).

  • hard_counts (np.ndarray) ‚Äì cluster assignments for the corresponding ‚Äòchunk_stats‚Äô table.

  • sampled_breaks (dict) ‚Äì sequence length of each chunk per experiment.

  • n_folds (int) ‚Äì number of folds for cross validation. If None (default) leave-one-experiment-out CV is used.

  • verbose (int) ‚Äì verbosity level. Must be an integer between 0 (nothing printed) and 3 (all is printed).

Returns:

trained supervised model on the full dataset, mapping chunk stats to cluster assignments. Useful to run the SHAP explainability pipeline. cluster_gbm_performance (dict): cross-validated dictionary containing trained estimators and performance metrics. groups (list): cross-validation indices. Data from the same animal are never shared between train and test sets.

Return type:

full_cluster_clf (imblearn.pipeline.Pipeline)

deepof.post_hoc.explain_clusters(chunk_stats: DataFrame, hard_counts: ndarray, full_cluster_clf: Pipeline, samples: int = 10000)ÔÉÅ

Compute SHAP feature importance for models mapping chunk_stats to cluster assignments.

Parameters:

  • chunk_stats (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì matrix with statistics per chunk, sorted by experiment.

  • hard_counts (np.ndarray) ‚Äì cluster assignments for the corresponding ‚Äòchunk_stats‚Äô table.

  • full_cluster_clf (imblearn.pipeline.Pipeline) ‚Äì trained supervised model on the full dataset, mapping chunk stats to cluster assignments.

  • samples (int) ‚Äì number of samples to draw from the original chunk_stats dataset.

Returns:

shap_values per cluster. explainer (shap.explainers._kernel.Kernel): trained SHAP KernelExplainer.

Return type:

shap_values (list)
